A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I recently upscored the Last Yedi. And i think you should too. The thing is that rotten tomatoes seems to not include scores below 1\,5 Stars into its Audience Score. I had the feeling that 47% is way to high for such a steaming pile of shit so i went through 400 user scores and forced them into an Excel table. (NOTE: I did not include "-NOT INTERESTED" or "+WANT TO SEE" into my table).
In the end if you take every single score into account i endet up at 25.70% Audience Score.
0\,0 - 5\,0 Stars - 25\,70%
0\,5 - 5\,0 Stars - 26\,16%
1\,0 - 5\,0 Stars - 32\,05%
1\,5 - 5\,0 Stars - 50\,44%
2\,0 - 5\,0 Stars - 61\,07%
2\,5 - 5\,0 Stars - 77\,62%
3\,0 - 5\,0 Stars - 85\,15%
These are the numbers i ended up with. To be fair there is a big discrepancy between 50\,44% and 47% so take these numbers with a grain of salt. One thing is clear thow.  They most likly do not include scores below 1 and likly socres below 1\,5 into their ratings. Thats why i gave it a 1\,5 Star rating this time. Just so this wonderfull masterpiece gets not the voting we want but at least comes closer to the voting it deserves.
I think most of you already did a good job in pointing out the flaws\, lacking logic\, bad pacing\, horrific characters and character development (that is if the character had a personalitity in the first place\, i am looking at you Mary Sue.) that this movie featured.
I will boycott both the Hansolo Movie and Star Wars IX and I'd recommend you to do so too.
